Sherlock fans were shocked when John Watson’s wife Mary was last night killed as she saved the life of the detective. 
Mary, played by Amanda Abbington, jumped in the way of a bullet bound for Sherlock Holmes , played by Benedict Cumberbatch. 
The death of the character, who had just welcomed her first child, Rosamund, with husband John (Amanda’s former real-life partner, Martin Freeman ) sent viewers into meltdown. 
But Amanda admitted she loved filming the shock scenes. 
The actress said: “It was sensitively handled but it was good fun because I work with these guys and they are brilliant. Sherlock his a favourite among viewers and critics alike (Photo: BBC) 
“It is a dream as an actor because you can be completely self-indulgent and go to town with it. And I probably did a bit.” Read More Amanda Abbington on 'upsetting' split from Martin Freeman - and filming Sherlock just two weeks after breakup 
Benedict said the gut-wrenching scene was hard to shoot. 
He said: “It was emotional. This important part of Sherlock is suddenly no more in the most violent way imaginable. A mother as well as a wife and a dear friend. It was a very upsetting scene to film.” 
Writer Steven Moffat said the scenes were designed to shock fans. Sherlock Holmes is played by Benedict Cumberbatch (Photo: PA) 
Asked why he didn't wait until later in the series, Moffat said: “Why would that be better? The truth is Mary has been dead for 100 years, so it is hard to surprise people in those circumstances. Read More 
“So the only thing we could do was do it earlier than people thought so it would happen as wrenchingly and as horrifically and things happen in real life so that is what we went for.” Like us on Facebook
